meanings.definition: The act of rendering something inactive or ineffective.
meanings.sent1: The inactivation of the alarm system caused confusion in the building.
meanings.sent2: The inactivation of the old computer led to a faster workflow.
meanings.sent3: The inactivation of the remote control made the family resort to manual channel changing.
meanings.sent4: Her inactivation of the opponent's strategy was swift and decisive.
meanings.sent5: The inactivation of the virus saved the computer from harm.

meanings.definition: The state of being made inactive or ineffective.
meanings.sent1: The inactivation of the machinery resulted in a temporary shutdown.
meanings.sent2: The inactivation of the account was due to suspicious activity.
meanings.sent3: The inactivation of the TV remote made it useless for changing channels.
meanings.sent4: The inactivation of the power grid left the town in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The inactivation of the enzyme halted the chemical reaction.
